description: 75 flats in buildings ranging in height from two to six-storeys and 5 three-storey houses fronting Deodar Road. 95 sq.m of retail floorspace fronting Brewhouse Street, with health and fitness club in basement; 1372 sq.m of restaurant floorspace;  1011 sq.m of office floorspace.  Public squares, cycle way and riverside walk. Basement parking for 170 cars to cater for both this site and former ICL Tower site.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development shall be begun within 5 years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - Details of those parts of the site not covered by building(s), including any parking areas, access ways, surface treatment, street furniture, lighting and boundary treatment, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the development begins.
To ensure a high quality of development in compliance with Council policy TBE3. 
Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding any materials specified in the application, details and samples of materials proposed to be used on all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any works are commenced. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials. 
In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy TBE3.
Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding details shown on the approved drawings, further elevation details including details of balconies, windows and materials detailing shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development.
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to details and control the appearance of the building.
Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding details shown on the approved drawings, further elevation details including windows and detailing of any alterations or extension to the Isherwood building shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the development commences.
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to details and control the appearance of the building.
Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding what is shown on the approved plans full details of the treatment and levels of the riverside walk and public open spaces shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before development commences. 
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to the details of the site treatment.
Condition : 7 - Details of proposals for the storage and disposal of refuse (including refuse arrangements for A3 uses) shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the development starts.  The approved works for the storage and disposal of refuse for each dwelling and/or other unit hereby permitted shall be constructed and available for use prior to the first occupation of the dwellings or other unit requiring the same. 
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to details of the site treatment.
Condition : 8 - Any trees or shrubs planted as part of a landscape scheme approved as part of this decision, or arising from a condition imposed on this decision, which within a period of five years from the completion of the development is found to be dead,  removed, or becomes seriously damaged or diseased,  shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of similar size and species.
To safeguard the appearance of the development, in accordance with Council policies TBE3 and TBE13.
Condition : 9 - The parking area(s) shown on the approved plans shall be provided before the occupation of  any part of the development, and shall be retained for parking purposes for the users of the development and for no other purpose. 
To ensure adequate arrangements are made for off-street parking.
Condition : 10 - The restaurant/public house/leisure facilities shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 800 and 2400 and at no other times.
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy S21. 
Condition : 11 - Detailed particulars of the insulation of the buildings against the transmission of noise and vibration between commercial activities and residential uses shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the development starts and the premises used in full accordance with such details. 
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to details of building insulation.
Condition : 12 - The whole of the parking accommodation shown on the approved plasn shall be retained for parking purposes for the users of the approved development other than those spaces agreed for community/church use and for no other purpose.
To ensure that adequate provision is made for off-street parking.
Condition : 13 - The  use hereby permitted shall not include use in connection with the hiring, distribution of or trading in motor vehicles, or in connection with driving instruction. 
Inadequate parking and service facilities are provided for such uses.
Condition : 14 - The A3 uses hereby approved shall not be implemented before an approved ventilation system is installed, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and a contract for the maintenance of the ventilation system agreed, details of which shall have been submitted to the local planning authority prior to installation.  Any external ducting installed shall be clad in facing materials to match the building(s) and shall be removed within 2 months of the cessation of the use of the premise(s) within Class A3 of the Town and Country Planning Act (Use Classes) Order 1987. 
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to details of the ventilation treatment.
Condition : 15 - Details of means of lighting the access routes, public areas and riverside walk, including positions and heights of any columns and means of preventing light spillage and pollution shall be submitted to the local planning authority prior to the development commencing and shall be retained unless otherwise agreed in writing. 
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to details of lighting for public safety and to protect the amenity of adjoining properties.
Condition : 16 - Before the development is commenced a detailed site investigation shall be carried out to establish if the site is contaminated, to assess the degree and nature of the contamination present, and to determine its potential for pollution of the river environment.  The method and extent of this site investigation shall be agreed with the local planning authority before commencement of the work.  Details of appropriate measures to prevent pollution of ground water and surface water, including provisions for monitoring, shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before development starts.  The development shall then proceed in strict accordance with the measures approved.
Condition : 17 - Surface water control and drainage details shall be carried out in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before development starts. 
To prevent pollution of the water environment.
